RT @JChengWSJ Reuters: When @DrTedros returned from Beijing in January, advisers encouraged him to use less effusive language. Tedros was adamant. “We knew how it was going to look, and he can sometimes be a bit naive about that."

DELUSIONAL: Axelrod believes Trump should follow Obama’s advice on who should be National Security Advisor. Voters elected Trump in part bc they DIDN’T want POTUS to send billions to Iran, to weaken our military, to undermine Israel & to refuse to say “radical Islamic terrorism.” https://twitter.com/davidaxelrod/status/1261446679565221889 QT @davidaxelrod So @BarackObama advised @realDonaldTrump not to hire Flynn as nat sec adviser.
Trump ignored the advice.
Flynn proceeded to lie to the @FBI and @VP about his call with the Russian ambassador, for which Trump fired him and Flynn pleaded guilty.
And this is Obama’s fault?!?

Late last night Trump fired the State Department Inspector General who had reportedly opened an investigation into Mike Pompeo. 

His firing must be investigated. Immediately.

While nearly 40 million Americans have filed for unemployment, the billionaire class is adding hundreds of billions of dollars to their wealth. If that doesn’t demonstrate our rigged economy I don’t know what does.

President Trump has fired so many independent IGs that I’ve lost count. He replaces them with partisan cronies to cover up corruption and incompetence. Trump’s actions eat away at our democracy and erode Americans’ faith in government. https://www.politico.com/news/2020/05/15/state-department-inspector-general-fired-261536

I've said it before and I'll say it again: Trump doesn't like to be accountable to anyone⁠—that's why he fires IGs left and right.

Strong oversight is only a threat to those who have something to hide. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EX0xgvPXsAIh8US.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1260216888958898176/vid/320x320/N2QPNKR2_Ae9ETHR.mp4?tag=13

2/x This arrogance—not understanding the voters rejected their “America Last” foreign policy & their ruinous economic policy—is what led to them abusing CIA & FBI to target their enemies. Obama & Biden were certain they’re right—voters be damned—and the ends justify the means. https://twitter.com/tedcruz/status/1261693226140000257 QT @tedcruz DELUSIONAL: Axelrod believes Trump should follow Obama’s advice on who should be National Security Advisor. RT @MichaelBerrySho Between my 2nd & 3rd years of law school (summer 95), I clerked for a DC firm & lived at the University Club, where the greatest #SCOTUS justice of all time would often come to smoke cigars. He allowed me (& my bride, the arm at left) to come to his chambers for an afternoon. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EYKnpUvWoAMeVG5.jpg

We need to revitalize independent farms & phase out factory farming—that’s what my bill aims to do. https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/5/8/21248618/coronavirus-meat-shortage-food-supply-chain-grocery-stores

.@SpeakerPelosi's $3 trillion monstrosity is a windfall for her radical liberal agenda, not relief for the workers, families, and job creators hurting from #COVID19.
 
Here are five of her most radical proposals ⤵️

I’ve introduced the biggest bill since Watergate to #EndCorruptionNow. And just this week, I introduced a bill to #StopCOVIDCorruption. Both of these bills will empower and protect IGs. Congress could vote on both of these bills right now – and they should.

What’s NOT in the bill?
✖️Addressing China’s #CoronavirusCoverUp
✖️Helping Americans get back to work
✖️Protecting American jobs

The firings of multiple Inspectors General is unprecedented; doing so
without good cause chills the independence essential to their purpose. It is a threat to accountable democracy and a fissure in the constitutional balance of power.

Our approach is simple, efficient, and universal:

If they have two Black teachers, it’s 32%. 

Investing in HBCUs and public education matters.

This is true only if you refuse to root for America. EVERYONE should celebrate that an infectious disease has not killed our President. Our broken food system is hurting farmers, hurting consumers, and hurting our environment.

The monopolistic practices of large multinational corporations in the agriculture sector put us all at risk.

While wealthy people quarantine in the luxury of their summer homes, low-income workers are being forced to go back to work and put their lives on the line.
 
This virus has grossly exposed the inequities of our economic system.

There's no returning to "normal" after this. We should aspire towards something better—a society in which the dignity of every human being is upheld, the presence of justice is universal, and love reigns supreme.
